messages.title: For the many, not the few.
messages.content: On 8 June, families in NORTH EAST HERTS can choose between a Labour government that stands up for the many, or the Tories who only look after a privileged few.

messages.title: Our pledges to you
messages.content: Give all children a chance to achieve, provide affordable homes to rent and buy, defend our NHS and tackle the care crisis, put the public back into our economy and services, protect living standards and create new high-quality jobs, and build a progressive tax system.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Give all children a chance to achieve
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Labour will not only end devastating cuts to our local schools, we'll provide school meal funds for primary school children and reduce class sizes for all.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Provide affordable homes to rent and buy
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Labour will build more than one million new homes, ban letting fees in private rents, and scrap lifetime tenancies.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Defend our NHS and tackle the care crisis
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Labour will save the NHS and social care services from cuts imposed by the current government.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Put the public back into our economy and services
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Labour will bring rail companies into public ownership and create new, high-quality public jobs.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Protect living standards and create new high-quality jobs
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Labour will introduce a real Living Wage of £10 per hour and invest in infrastructure, skills and jobs.

issues.brexitEurope: Labour sees this next chapter as a chance to once again create a Britain for the many - not the few; a Brexit that builds stronger relationships and a fairer economy for all.
issues.economy: Labour will bring rail companies into public ownership and create new, high-quality public jobs.
issues.education: Labour will not only end devastating cuts to our local schools, we'll provide school meal funds for primary school children and reduce class sizes for all. Labour would provide adequate funding for schools and restore student maintenance grants, rather than lavishing £138 million on 'Free Schools' and re-introducing
issues.health: Waiting lists have soared to around 3.8 million; last year over 1.8 million people waited longer than 4 hours in A&E; and £4.6 billion has been cut from social care budgets. We will end health service privatisation and bring services into a secure, publicly-provided NHS.

community.content: Labour will build more than one million new homes, ban letting fees in private rents, and scrap lifetime tenancies.

leaflet.personalStatement: Having made Letchworth my home for over 11 years, I feel extremely proud to be standing as your Labour candidate in the General Election this June. There are times in our lives when we all feel the need to make a decisive stand for what we believe is right, not just for ourselves, but for our whole country. The ideological Tory cuts are unnecessary, and an alternative is possible.

politicalExperience.role: Labour candidate for North East Hertfordshire

endorsements.endorser: Alex Mayer, Member of the European Parliament
endorsements.endorsement: I'm backing Doug Swanney as a strong voice for North East Herts. Working families deserve better than Tory failure. Only Labour will stand up for you.

images.caption: For the many, not the few

examples: Waiting lists have soared to around 3.8 million; last year over 1.8 million people waited longer than 4 hours in A&E; and £4.6 billion has been cut from social care budgets.
Labour would provide adequate funding for schools and restore student maintenance grants, rather than lavishing £138 million on 'Free Schools' and re-introducing
Many Hertfordshire headteachers have written to parents about 35 to 45 per cent cuts in funding per pupil.
The ideological Tory cuts are unnecessary, and an alternative is possible.
Working families deserve better than Tory failure. Only Labour will stand up for you.
Labour will not only end devastating cuts to our local schools, we'll provide school meal funds for primary school children and reduce class sizes for all.
Labour will build more than one million new homes, ban letting fees in private rents, and scrap lifetime tenancies.
Labour will bring rail companies into public ownership and create new, high-quality public jobs.
Labour sees this next chapter as a chance to once again create a Britain for the many - not the few; a Brexit that builds stronger relationships and a fairer economy for all.

Waiting lists have soared to around 3.8 million; last year over 1.8 million people waited longer than 4 hours in A&E; and £4.6 billion has been cut from social care budgets. We will end health service privatisation and bring services into a secure, publicly-provided NHS.

personalStories.story: Having made Letchworth my home for over 11 years, I feel extremely proud to be standing as your Labour candidate in the General Election this June.

examples: I'm backing Doug Swanney as a strong voice for North East Herts. Working families deserve better than Tory failure. Only Labour will stand up for you.
Only Labour makes the case for what is fair and for what you need. We are not the Nasty Party, but one that has the welfare of everyone at our heart.
Waiting lists have soared to around 3.8 million; last year over 1.8 million people waited longer than 4 hours in A&E; and £4.6 billion has been cut from social care budgets.
The Tories want this election to be about an angry and destructive Brexit, with burnt bridges and division at its heart.
